cons: Anyone taking artichoke leaf for a different purpose should be aware it may cause more frequent urination.
Not enough reliable information about the safety of taking artichoke if you are pregnant or breast feeding. Stay on the safe side and avoid use.
description: 1. 100 g of this flower bud just carries 47 calories.  It is one of the finest sources of dietary fiber and antioxidants.

Dietary-fiber helps control constipation conditions, decreases bad or "LDL" cholesterol levels by binding to it in the intestines and help cut down colon cancer risks by preventing toxic compounds in the food from absorption.
It is one of the good vegetable sources for vitamin-K.Vitamin-K plays a vital role in bone health through promoting osteotropic activity.
Adequate vitamin-K levels in the diet help limiting neuronal damage in the brain.
The artichoke is a rich source of minerals like copper, calcium, potassium, iron, manganese and phosphorus.
name: Artichoke
pros: 1. 100 g of this flower bud just carries 47 calories.  It is one of the finest sources of dietary fiber and antioxidants.

Dietary-fiber helps control constipation conditions, decreases bad or "LDL" cholesterol levels by binding to it in the intestines and help cut down colon cancer risks by preventing toxic compounds in the food from absorption.
It is one of the good vegetable sources for vitamin-K.Vitamin-K plays a vital role in bone health through promoting osteotropic activity.
Adequate vitamin-K levels in the diet help limiting neuronal damage in the brain.
The artichoke is a rich source of minerals like copper, calcium, potassium, iron, manganese and phosphorus.
Good Source of Iron, Which Prevents Anemia.
Consuming iron-rich foods is a great way to prevent anemia and negative symptoms associated with iron deficiency.
Artichokes can cause some side effects, such as intestinal gas and allergic reactions.
